meanings.definition: The action of transferring something or the process of being transferred.
meanings.sent1: The transference of data from one device to another was quick and efficient.
meanings.sent2: The transference of ownership of the house was completed smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The transference of snacks from the bag to my mouth was so fast, I didn't even notice!
meanings.sent4: The transference of knowledge from teacher to student is like a river flowing endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The transference of power in the kingdom was marked by a grand ceremony.

meanings.definition: The redirection of feelings from one person to another, especially those unconsciously retained from childhood.
meanings.sent1: The transference of love from her ex-boyfriend to her new partner was evident.
meanings.sent2: The transference of anger from her boss to her colleagues created tension in the office.
meanings.sent3: The transference of excitement from the puppy to the kitten was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The transference of emotions in the room was palpable, like a storm brewing.
meanings.sent5: The transference of fear from the horror movie stayed with her long after it ended.
